lily_returns.speaker: Narrator
lily_returns.text: Lily has returned to the cafe. She sits at her usual table, a small notebook open before her, filled with meticulous notes.

lily_observation.speaker: Lily
lily_observation.text: *Without looking up* I've been observing your kitchen for several days now. Your technique is... unrefined. Your plating inconsistent. Your timing variable.

lily_pause.speaker: Lily
lily_pause.text: *She finally looks up, her expression unreadable* And yet... your customers leave satisfied. It's baffling.

player_respond_critique.speaker: Narrator
player_respond_critique.text: How do you respond to her critique?

choices.text: I cook with heart. That's what matters most.
I'm always trying to improve. What would you suggest?
Not everyone needs perfection to enjoy a good meal.

lily_dismissive.speaker: Lily
lily_dismissive.text: Heart. *She scoffs, but there's something in her eyes* My mentor used to say the same thing. I thought it was just an excuse for sloppiness.

lily_respect.speaker: Lily
lily_respect.text: *Her expression softens slightly* A willingness to learn. That's... rare. Most people defend their mediocrity rather than strive to overcome it.

lily_triggered.speaker: Lily
lily_triggered.text: *Her jaw tightens* Perfection isn't about others. It's about... *She stops herself* Never mind. You wouldn't understand.

lily_backstory_hint.speaker: Lily
lily_backstory_hint.text: I once worked in the finest restaurant in the capital. Every dish had to be flawless. A single wilted garnish could end a career. One mistake... ended mine.

lily_vulnerability.speaker: Lily
lily_vulnerability.text: *She looks away* I left before they could dismiss me. Pride, perhaps. Or cowardice. Now I wander, judging others' kitchens because I can no longer face my own.

lily_recovery.speaker: Lily
lily_recovery.text: *She straightens, composure returning* Forgive me. That was... unprofessional. *She closes her notebook* Perhaps you could show me your signature dish sometime.
